summary: A letter from the New Mexico Attorney General's Office to the Acting U.S. Attorney requesting federal asset forfeiture of Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Ranch property in Stanley, New Mexico. The letter asserts the ranch was used to facilitate and conceal child trafficking and seeks its seizure in connection with prosecutions of Epstein's associates.

persons.name: Hector H. Balderas
persons.context: The Attorney General of New Mexico whose office is providing investigative evidence and requesting federal asset forfeiture of Epstein's Zorro Ranch property.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier whose estate owns the Zorro Ranch, which is alleged to have been used to facilitate and conceal child trafficking.

persons.name: Clara Moran
persons.role: Chief Deputy Attorney General of New Mexico
persons.context: The author of the letter, signing on behalf of the New Mexico Attorney General's Office to formally request federal asset forfeiture of the Zorro Ranch.

connections.description: Balderas, as Attorney General, is leading a state-level effort to assist federal prosecutors in seizing Epstein's assets related to alleged crimes in New Mexico.
Moran, as Chief Deputy Attorney General, is formally requesting federal action to forfeit Epstein's property on behalf of the state.
The document references pending criminal prosecutions against Epstein's associates and co-conspirators, implying a network involved in the alleged crimes.

events.title: NM AG's Forfeiture Request
events.description: The New Mexico Attorney General's Office formally requests the Acting U.S. Attorney to pursue civil asset forfeiture of Jeffrey Epstein's Zorro Ranch property.

keyFacts: The New Mexico Attorney General's Office has provided investigative evidence that Jeffrey Epstein used his Zorro Ranch in Stanley, New Mexico, to facilitate and conceal child trafficking.
The office is formally requesting the federal government to seize the Zorro Ranch and any substitute assets through civil forfeiture proceedings.
The request is made to support the pending federal criminal prosecution of Epstein's associates and co-conspirators.
The stated goal is to achieve justice, closure, and restitution for survivors of crimes committed by Epstein in New Mexico.
